pros: Great people Great mission Great leadership
cons: Really none to speak of

review_title: I'd give it zero stars if I could.
pros: The patients and families were amazing.
cons: Cons - everything else. I had a genuinely terrible experience working here. From the awful nurse who "precepted" me to the verbally abusive clinical manager, to the $32/hr they paid me in 2018, it was an awful experience. I now know why they require you to sign a 2-year contract (which 5 out of 6 nurses in my orientation class broke - that's how bad it was there). They tout the fact that your hours are 8:00-4:30 Monday through Friday with no weekends or holidays, but you will actually work 7am to 7pm to get all of your documentation done. And you will not get paid a penny extra. They act like you are are paid hourly (as if you would get paid for the extra hours you are forced to work) but this is NOT TRUE. You are a salaried employee and will not get paid for any time over 40 hours a week. I could go on and on, but I would advise you not to work here if you value work-life balance or a manageable workload. Lastly, the culture is very "corporate". It's not at all like any other nursing job I've had. The nurses are treated like the low people on the totem pole. I would not go back to this job if they paid me $200/hr.

pros: The people here really care about their work.
cons: Not a lot of growth for administrative staff.

review_title: Working for Care Dimensions doesn't feel like a job!
job_title: Registered Nurse, Case Manager in Danvers, MA
pros:
I have been working for Care Dimensions for 6 years and will be with them for many more. Over the years I have only seen improvement in our company. They have decreased our Nurse/patient ratio (to the best of their ability given COVID pandemic), employee complaints/requests are always heard and improved upon unless unreasonable (Nurses making 6 figures are few and far between and probably miserable from the overtime!), and the vacation time available is, frankly, unheard of! As a single, full time working Mom it is super difficult to find enough time in the day to "do it all"! Hospice care is exhausting and Care Dimensions has always been mindful of much needed days off. Management is very reasonable and recognizes that family should always come first. Education is extensive given the sensitive nature of our field and I have never felt unsupported by my co-workers. This was truly impressive to me given that I am alone in my car, traveling to patient homes everyday. I had less support at previous jobs in acute care settings. 
"Choose a job you love and you will never work a day in your life." Confucius
I cannot say enough about Care Dimensions, from the top down this company whole-heartedly strives to take care of both patients and employees.
cons: I would say the cons are not really concerning to me as the pros vastly outweigh them in comparison. However, I guess generally I have heard the salary is lower than that of other available RN positions. But for me, it is not an issue even being a single Mom because I believe in my job and I believe in my company 100%.

pros: Positive, supportive, inclusive and collaborative tone at the top. The Executive Team is truly dedicated to the organization's mission and always prioritizes patient care - so because of that we employ the most special and amazing employees across all departments. Everyone has a "how can I help you" attitude. Pros: Tone at the top = A+, competitive fringe benefits, retirement plan and time off, supportive environment, robust in house IT support and equipment, hybrid/flexible schedules depending on your department, EXCELLENT orientation and thorough trainings/education, employee town halls, wellness development opportunities, employee engagement activities, volunteer opportunities and most importantly working for a company that takes care of the community by serving patients and their families when they need help the most.
cons: None. Star ratings given in this review are based on non-profit companies. Please take into consideration that for profits may be able to pay more but quality of life and employee satisfaction and engagement can (should) outweigh a higher base pay.

review_title: Excellent Company to Work For and Grow Within.
pros: Care Dimensions has always been non-profit and managed from the CEO down to Clinical Managers by former Nurses. We are patient and family care focused and have deep roots in the communities we serve in Massachusetts.
cons: None that I can think of after over seven years of service.

pros:

review_title: High patient loads, high turnover, non-trusting atmosphere, never a thank you for going above and beyond.
job_title: RN Case Manager in Danvers, MA
pros: The nature of the work is very satisfying. The relationships with the patients and families is why I became a nurse in the first place, especially a hospice nurse.
cons: Horrible hours, incessant demands by managers to take on more patients. Being told "I'm weak", because I can't work my regular shift after seeing patients most of the night from 4:30pm to 8:00am the next day. When I was told that I could quit if I didn't like how they did things, I did and found a great job at another hospice, where I've been the last 2 years. Same job, same workload (it's hospice!), but in a corporate atmosphere that recognizes hard work and dedication. Just being told "thank you" is what most of us need when we've had a tough week.

pros: great of work place environment
cons: A lot of bad manager!

pros: The staff at Care Dimensions is among the best  I have ever worked with.   There is a strong sense of "team" providing good support to all.  The mission is one that I strongly believe in and the care we provide to patients at end of life is something to be proud of.   For our department I do find that our Manager is constantly seeking ways to improve our daily processes to help us work smarter and not harder.
cons: The business has grown considerably over the past 5 years and some days are so busy that staff find themselves multi-tasking a little more than they may be comfortable with.

review_title: Mission Driven Organization with Compassionate Employees
pros: An amazing organization with a mission that keeps employees striving to achieve excellence every day.  I truly enjoy coming to work every day, and love the work I do.  How many people can say that?  Care Dimensions makes a difference for so many patients and families, thanks to the devoted, compassionate employees.  I'm proud to work here.
cons: As we continue to grow and expand, the organization naturally feels occasional "growing pains".  Care Dimensions has responded in the most effective ways, such as increasing staffing, implementing new technological solutions, and creating new programs, just to name a few!
